topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Prerequisites - Download the Installation Packages (ConRef)

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Installation Prerequisites

body.p: This document is a repository for the download information to be shared among the deployment instructions:
This document describes the prerequisite steps to download the installation files required to install HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.title: Launch the Software Depot
section.p: Launch the the Software Depot for HP Helion Carrier Grade. You must obtain an HP Passport user account in order to download these files.

ol.li: Click Sign In to log in using your HP Passport account.
After signing in, click the Select button on the right side of the page.
Enter your personal information and address and accept the license agreement and click Next.

For the software you want to download, listed below, select the download method:
Use HPE Download Manager. Use the HPE Download Manager to specify where the installation package will be saved.
Use Standard Download. Use the standard download method for your browser.
For example:
If you selected to use the HPE Download Manager, and this is the first time you have download the HPE Software Depot from the current computer, you will need to install the HPE Download Manager:
In the Open HP_Download_Manager.exe dialog box, click Save As.
Locate and double-click the downloaded HP_Download_Manager.exe file.
Accept the license agreement and click Next to use the wizard to install.

body.section:
In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Click the Downloads tab and locate the following download.
HCG 2.0 KVM ESX Ironic VRS Part 1 of 1 Installation files for the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Tahoe, Memphis, and Sacramento deployments. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar.gz file.
HCG 2.0 KVM ESX Ironic VRS Part 1 of 1 sha256. The SHA256 checksum for HP Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 VRS. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar.gz.sha256 file.
HCG 2.0 KVM ESX Ironic VRS Part 1 of 1 sig. The signature file for HP Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 VRS. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar.gz.sig file.
HCG 2.0 KVM ESX Ironic VRS Part 2 of 2 Installation files for the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Tahoe, Memphis, and Sacramento deployments. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs_part2of2.tar.gz file.
HCG 2.0 KVM ESX Ironic VRS Part 2 of 2 sha. The SHA256 checksum for HP Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 VRS. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs_part2of2.tar.gz.sha256 file.
HCG 2.0 KVM ESX Ironic VRS Part 2 of 2 sig. The signature file for HP Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 VRS. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs_part2of2.tar.gz.sig file.
GPG Keys to Verify Signature Files The public keys for HP Helion Carrier Grade 2.0.
Click the Downloads tab and locate the following download.
HCG 2.0 KVM AVS Installation files for the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Tahoe, Memphis, and Sacramento deployments. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_avs.tar.gz file.
HCG 2.0 KVM AVS sha256. The SHA256 checksum for HP Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 VRS. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_avs.tar.gz.sha256 file.
HCG 2.0 KVM AVS sig. The signature file for HP Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 VRS. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_avs.tar.gz.sig file.
GPG keys to verify signature files The public keys for HP Helion Carrier Grade 2.0.
Optionally, download the Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Infoblox Plugin. Also, download the checksum and signature files.
Download the following mandatory patches:
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Heat001 Patch003. This patch addresses a number of issues.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 WR002 Patch005.This patch addresses a number of issues in the KVM region.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 WR003 Patch007. This patch fixes the PCI Bus Assignment for VM Guest.
HCG2.0_Icinga001_Patch008. This patch creates a random password to log into the Icinga interface.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Keystone001_Patch010. This patch fixes a problem with the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade certificate.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Stackrc001 Patch011 -- Sacramento only. This patch fixes issue where the baremetal service (Ironic) is not able to use the CAN endpoint.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 RMQ001 Patch012. This patch fixes a problem with the logging of the RabbitMQ service.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Log001 Patch013. This patch fixes a problem with the RabbitMQ service installed on HP Helion OpenStack CarrierGrade.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 ELK001 Patch014. This patch addresses several ELK (ElasticSearch, Logstash, Kibana) related issues.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 LOG002 Patch015. This is an optional patch to change the logging of the services from INFO or DEBUG to WARNING.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 WR004 Patch017. This patch addresses a number of issues in the KVM region.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 DCN003 Patch018. This patch installs a cURL script that can be used to enable floating IP addressing on the VRS-G node.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 WR005 Patch019. This patch addresses a number of issues in the KVM region.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Accelerate001 Patch023. This patch resolves the issue Failed to launch the accelerated daemon encountered during the hlm deploy process during installation.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 BMEndpoint001 Patch024. This patch resolves the issue with Horizon accessing Baremetal region to updates the creation of a certificate that can be updated in future patches.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 WR006 Patch025. This patch addresses a number of issues in the KVM region.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 WR007 Patch027. This patch addresses a security issue in the KVM region. Replaces Patch026.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 WR008 Patch029. This patch addresses a security issue in the KVM region. Replaces Patch029.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 WR009 Patch030. This patch addresses a number of issues in the KVM region.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 HCG-OVS001 Patch028. This patch fixes the buffer overflow in openvswitch debian versions 2.2.x through 2.3.x allows for Remot Code Execution, and in 2.4.0 - 2.4.8 allows for Denial of Service and possible RCE.
Note: When downloading installation files, always download and verify the associated checksum and signature files before installing.
You should have downloaded these files during the prerequisites. If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN) and locate the patch files and the associated checksum and signature files. You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files.
Post-install patches; linked to in Post Install page, not pre-reqs

section.p: Note: When downloading installation files, always download and verify the signature file before installing.

section.title: Verify the downloaded signature
section.p: After downloading the installation packages, you should verify the signature of the download. You can use the GPG utility, which is already installed on the lifecycle manager host. Signed by the signature file.

A set of GPG public keys are available on Helion Download Network(HDN) . If you did not download the public keys in the previous section, click the GPG Keys to Verify Signature Files link in HDN to download the GPG-HPCSS-Public-Keys.tar file.

ol.li: Copy the GPG-HPCSS-Public-Keys.tar file to the /root/cg/ directory. You will need to create this directory:mkdir /root/cg/
Extract the file. tar xvf GPG-HPCSS-Public-Keys.tar

Copy the public keys to the lifecycle manager host, extract the keys from the compressed files.
The following keys are included in the download:
Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-1.pub
Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-2.pub
Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-3.pub
Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-4.pub
Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-5.pub
hpPublicKey.pub
hpPublicKey2048.pub

Execute the following command to import the keys: gpg --import "<filename>"
Where <filename> is the name of the extracted file.
The keys are then imported into the gpgp key share: gpg -\-import hpPublicKey.pub gpg -\-import Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA\(HPCodesigningService\)-1.pub gpg -\-import Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA\(HPCodesigningService\)-2.pub gpg -\-import Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA\(HPCodesigningService\)-3.pub gpg -\-import Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA\(HPCodesigningService\)-4.pub gpg -\-import Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA\(HPCodesigningService\)-5.pub gpg -\-import hpPublicKey2048.pub

Use the following command to view the keys in the key store: gpg -\-list-keys
The key store appears similar to the following:/home/sad/.gnupg/pubring.gpg -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\- pub 2048R/F7191CB9 2014-12-19 pub 1024D/2689B887 2005-03-11 [expired: 2015-03-09] uid Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company (HPE Codesigning Service) pub 2048R/B1275EA3 2014-11-19 [expires: 2024-11-16] uid Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company RSA (HPE Codesigning Service) - 1 pub 2048R/B564A643 2014-11-19 [expires: 2024-11-16] uid Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company RSA (HPE Codesigning Service) - 2 pub 2048R/FF94BC78 2014-11-19 [expires: 2024-11-16] uid Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company RSA (HPE Codesigning Service) - 3 pub 2048R/BA849975 2014-11-19 [expires: 2024-11-16] uid Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company RSA (HPE Codesigning Service) - 4 pub 2048R/C6978F0C 2014-11-19 [expires: 2024-11-16] uid Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company RSA (HPE Codesigning Service) - 5 pub 2048R/5CE2D476 2012-12-04 [expires: 2022-12-02] uid Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company RSA (HPE Codesigning Service)

Use the following command to verify the signature: gpg --verify ./hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar.gz.sig ./hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar.gz.sig
or
gpg --verify ./hcg2_kvm_avs.tar.gz ./hcg2_kvm_avs.tar.gz
The output for the command appears similar to the following. This indicates the signature is verified: Good signature from "Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company RSA (HPE Codesigning Service).gpg: Signature made Tue 08 Sept 2015 12:15:20 PM EDT using RSA key ID C6978F0C gpg: Good signature from "Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company RSA (HPE Codesigning Service) - 5" gpg: WARNING: This key is not certified with a trusted signature! gpg: There is no indication that the signature belongs to the owner. Primary key fingerprint: 2545 62E5 28F9 FE92 B85D 8200 FDF9 8F0C
Perform this verification for each file you downloaded.

section.title: Verify the downloaded checksums
section.p: You should also use a checksum verification tool, such as sha256sum, which should come installed with Ubuntu.

ol.li: Run the checksum tool against the download package:sha256sum <path-to-file>/hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar

Compare the output of the checksum tool to the download checksum file. sha256sum.exe hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar 774cf8be645cbd868acd0b2a8de811de86e283b17cbad849c313ef38c1af33f5 hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar.gzNote that the checksum file contains the date that the file was generated, the checksum string, and the name of the file that was used, similar to the following:Mon Dec 7 12:32:33 PST 2015 774cf8be645cbd868acd0b2a8de811de86e283b17cbad849c313ef38c1af33f5 hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar.gz
